person.persName: John E. Rice (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and private 22nd KY Inf USA)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Bath County native. Married to Margaret Brown Rice. Father of John M. Rice, James G. Rice, Mahala Rice, Isabella Rice, Benjamin F. Rice, Catharine Rice, Reason Rice, Martha Rice, Mary V. Rice, Annie M. C. Rice. Father of Laban McGlothin and William McGlothin Rice. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Employed James Staten as a laborer in Bath County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Employed his sons, John M. Rice and James G. Rice, as farm laborers in Bath County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 22nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private until reported as deserted from Richmond on April 9, 1863.
